intro: Specularia lamprosperma, commonly known as the glittering catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Specularia lamprosperma is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sandy soils.
